intro: Sisymbrium galeottianum, commonly known as Galeotti's winter cress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with pinnately divided leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in pods that split open when mature, dispersing the seeds by wind. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
